newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Former Brazil fin min joins local Salomon team.
newsitem.headline: Former Brazil fin min joins local Salomon team.

text.p: Former Brazilian Finance Minister Mailson F. da Nobrega has joined the Brazilian team of Salomon Brothers Inc and its local associate Banco Patrimonio as a consultant, the U.S. investment bank said.
Salomon Brothers said in a statement that da Nobrega, an independent consultant based in Sao Paulo, will provide political and economic advisory services to the firm's clients.
Da Nobrega was finance minister from 1988 to 1990, during which he also served as head of the National Monetary Council, the Federal Deregulation and Privatization Council and other federal bodies.

"His years of experience in the Brazilian pubic sector finance will provide added value to our clients in Brazil and Latin America," said Alberto Verme, managing director and head of Latin American investment banking at Salomon.
As minister, he also served as board governor for the International Monetary Fund, the World Bank and the Inter-American Development Bank.

Salomon also announced the following appointments at Patrimonio: Luiz Chrysostomo de Oliveira Filho as partner for corporate finance, Ricardo Stern as head of mergers and acquisitions, and Mauricio Folkerts as vice president covering corporate clients.
